item.title: Gujarat Themis Biosyn Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Bearish Trend Ahead
item.description: Gujarat Themis Biosyn Ltd, a prominent player in the Pharmaceuticals & Biotechnology sector, has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) crosses below the 200-DMA. This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, reflecting deteriorating momentum and raising concerns about the stock’s near to medium-term outlook. Time: 16 minutes ago

item.title: Shree Pushkar Chemicals & Fertilizers Ltd Forms Death Cross Signalling Bearish Trend
item.description: Shree Pushkar Chemicals & Fertilizers Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average. This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, reflecting a deterioration in the stock’s medium to long-term momentum and raising concerns about sustained weakness in the coming months. Time: 16 minutes ago

item.title: SG Mart Ltd Forms Golden Cross, Signalling Potential Bullish Breakout
item.description: SG Mart Ltd, a prominent player in the construction sector, has recently formed a Golden Cross—a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average crosses above the 200-day moving average. This development often signals a potential bullish breakout, suggesting a shift in long-term momentum and a possible trend reversal for the stock. Time: 17 minutes ago

item.title: 3B Blackbio DX Ltd Forms Golden Cross, Signalling Potential Bullish Breakout
item.description: 3B Blackbio DX Ltd, a micro-cap player in the Healthcare Services sector, has recently formed a Golden Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) has crossed above the 200 DMA. This development often signals a potential bullish breakout and a shift in long-term momentum, attracting investor attention despite the stock’s current Sell mojo grade of 47.0. Time: 17 minutes ago

item.title: Dec-2025 Quarterly Earnings Reveal Mixed Market Momentum with Strong Mid-Cap and Infrastructure Performances
item.description: The December 2025 quarterly earnings season has unfolded with a nuanced picture across Indian equities, as 3,139 companies declared results. While the overall proportion of positive earnings outcomes improved modestly to 47.0%, mid-cap stocks outperformed with a 53.0% positivity rate, signalling a shift in market leadership. Large caps lagged behind at 43.0%, reflecting a cautious environment amid mixed sectoral performances. Time: 17 minutes ago

item.title: R M Drip & Sprinklers Systems Ltd Hits New 52-Week High at Rs.114.95
item.description: R M Drip & Sprinklers Systems Ltd has reached a significant milestone by hitting a new 52-week high of Rs.114.95 today, marking a notable surge in its stock price and reflecting sustained momentum over recent weeks. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Artemis Electricals & Projects Ltd Reports Sharp Quarterly Decline Amid Negative Financial Trend
item.description: Artemis Electricals & Projects Ltd has experienced a marked deterioration in its recent quarterly financial performance, reversing a previously positive growth trajectory. The company’s latest results for the quarter ended December 2025 reveal significant contraction in profitability and operating margins, raising concerns among investors and analysts alike. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: SPA Capital Services Ltd Reports Strong Quarterly Growth Amid Sector Challenges
item.description: SPA Capital Services Ltd has demonstrated a marked improvement in its financial performance for the quarter ended December 2025, with significant growth in net sales and profitability metrics, signalling a positive shift in its financial trend despite a challenging broader market environment. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: MKVentures Capital Ltd Reports Declining Financial Trend Amidst Margin Pressures
item.description: MKVentures Capital Ltd, a player in the Non Banking Financial Company (NBFC) sector, has reported a marked deterioration in its recent quarterly financial performance, signalling a shift from a previously flat trend to a distinctly negative trajectory. Despite a modest rise in profit after tax (PAT) over nine months, the company’s latest six-month figures reveal significant contraction in sales and profitability, raising concerns among investors and analysts alike. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Indian Markets Retreat Sharply as Small Caps Drag Indices Lower on 13 Feb 2026
item.description: Indian equity markets witnessed a sharp correction on 13 Feb 2026, with the Sensex and Nifty closing down by over 1.2% amid widespread selling pressure. All sectors declined, led by metal stocks, while small caps bore the brunt of the downturn. Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) remained cautious, and domestic institutional investors (DIIs) showed limited buying interest, reflecting a cautious market mood amid mixed global cues. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Large-Cap Segment Sees Broad Weakness as BSE 100 Declines 1.3%
item.description: The large-cap segment, represented by the BSE 100 index, has experienced notable weakness over recent sessions, declining by 1.3% on the day and 1.51% over the past five days. This downturn reflects a broader market hesitation as investors weigh defensive and cyclical sector dynamics amid mixed technical signals from heavyweight constituents. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Small-Cap Segment Sees Broad Weakness Amid Select Bright Spots on 13 Feb 2026
item.description: The BSE Smallcap index declined by 0.63% on 13 Feb 2026, reflecting widespread weakness across the segment despite pockets of strong individual stock performances. With 970 stocks declining against 240 advancing, the advance-decline ratio of 0.25x underscores the breadth of the sell-off. This article analyses the recent trends in the small-cap space, sectoral dynamics, earnings updates, and technical shifts shaping investor sentiment. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Mid-Cap Segment Sees Broad Weakness as BSE Midcap Index Declines 0.61%
item.description: The BSE Midcap index experienced a modest decline of 0.61% on 13 Feb 2026, reflecting a cautious market mood as sectoral performances diverged sharply. While select stocks delivered robust gains, the broader mid-cap universe faced selling pressure, with a significant imbalance in advance-decline ratios underscoring the uneven market breadth. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: TARC Ltd Hits Intraday Low Amidst Price Pressure on 13 Feb 2026
item.description: TARC Ltd experienced a significant intraday decline on 13 Feb 2026, touching a low of Rs 151, reflecting a sharp 7.28% drop as the stock underperformed both its sector and the broader market amid prevailing negative sentiment. Time: 2 hours ago
